Every year since 2011, the Convergences Awards have rewarded innovative partnerships for the benefit of the common good. This year, the Awards are supported by IRD, IPPAG, as well as B&L Evolution, Devex and Mairie de Paris. They are open to projects carried out by a solidarity-based or academic/research organisation in partnership with private or public organisations.

Partnerships on the followings themes will be accepted: zero hunger, health, education, decent work, sustainable cities/communities.

 

This year, the Awards include 3 categories:

  • the International Convergences-IPPAG Award, which rewards a project whose beneficiaries are mainly located outside the French territory;
  • the International Research Convergences Award (supported by IRD), which rewards a project in which at least one of the partners is an academic or research organisation and whose beneficiaries are mainly located around the Mediterranean or in the tropics;
  • the special “Honorary” Award, which rewards a project in which at least one of the partners is an academic or research organisation.

 

Rewards: a financial dotation from 10,000 to 15,000 €, visibility through the participation to the Convergences World Forum, networking with Convergences’ stakeholders and a possibility of pro-bono support from our partners.

Innovative projects’ leaders, and solution creators for a “Zero Exclusion, Zero Carbon, Zero Poverty” world are invited to apply until March 25.
